name: Doctors Galore
title: Highest number of physicians per capita
description: In 2021, Cuba boasted an impressive 9.429 physicians per 1,000 people, showcasing its strong healthcare system.

name: Perfect Birth Records
title: Complete rural birth registration
description: As of 2019, Cuba achieved a 100% completeness rate in rural birth registration, ensuring every child is accounted for.

name: High Remittance Costs
title: Highest remittance transaction costs
description: In 2023, sending remittances to Cuba incurred a hefty average transaction cost of 19.63%, the highest globally.

name: Trade Challenges
title: Low merchandise trade as a percentage of GDP
description: In 2020, merchandise trade accounted for only 8.32% of Cuba's GDP, indicating limited trade activity.

name: Aid Dynamics
title: Mixed net official flows from UN agencies
description: Cuba received $500 from UNAIDS in 2017, but faced a negative flow of $3 from WTO-ITC in 2020, reflecting fluctuating international aid.

name: Domestic Duties
title: Significant unpaid domestic work by men
description: In 2016, Cuban men spent 12.47% of their day on unpaid domestic and care work, highlighting gender roles in household responsibilities.

name: Export Residuals
title: Notable merchandise export residuals
description: In 2023, residuals made up 4.05% of Cuba's total merchandise exports, indicating potential inefficiencies in export processes.
